name: Dijon and Cognac Beef Stew
description: A rich and flavorful beef stew enhanced with Dijon mustard, cognac, and red wine, with carrots and mushrooms.
ingredients: 4 to 6 tablespoons unsalted butter or bacon fat
4 large carrots, peeled and cut into half-moon slices
8 ounces mushrooms, stemmed, cleaned and quartered
instructions: Mise en Place:
For Steps 1-3
Finely dice 1 onion and put in a small bowl.
Chop 3 shallots and add to the onion bowl.
For Steps 4-8
Cut 2lbs beef chuck into 1-inch cubes and put into medium bowl
Measure 2Tbps of flour and put into a large bowl.
For Steps 9-12
Measure ½ cup Conac and put into pourable container.
Measure 2 cups Beef stock and put into a pourable container.
Measure 1 Tbsp of full grain mustard and add to the dijon bowl.
Measure 3 Tbsp of dijon mustard and set aside.
For Steps 12-16
Peel and slice 4 large carrots and put into a small bowl.
Measure, stem, clean, and quarter 8 ounces of mushrooms and put into a small bowl.
Measure ½ cup Dijon mustard and put into a small bowl.
Measure ¼ cup red wine.
Melt 2 Tbps of butter in a dutch oven over medium heat until foam subsides.
add onion and shallots to pot and cook until softened but not browned, 10 to 15 minutes.
Use a slotted spoon to transfer to a large bowl.
If necessary, add 2 tablespoons butter to the pot to augment fat.
Dust beef cubes with flour, and season with salt and pepper.
Shake off excess flour, and place half the cubes in the pot.
Cook the beef over medium-high heat until well browned, almost crusty, on all sides.
Transfer the beef to a bowl with onions. Repeat with remaining beef.
Add Cognac to the empty pot, and cook, stirring, until the bottom is deglazed and the crust comes loose.
Add stock, Dijon mustard and 1 tablespoon Pommery mustard. Whisk to blend
Return meat and onion mixture to pot.
Lower heat, partly cover, and simmer gently until meat is very tender, about 1 1/2 hours.
Add carrots, and continue simmering for 30 minutes, or until slices are tender.
As they cook, heat 2 tablespoons butter in a medium skillet over medium-high, and sauté mushrooms until browned.
Stir mushrooms into stew along with remaining mustard and red wine.
Simmer 5 minutes, then taste, and adjust seasoning. Serve hot.
